hero.title: Hello, I'm Philip
hero.subtitle: Web & app development, bots, and automation—custom solutions tailored for you.

projects.title: My Projects
projects.description: Here are some of the projects I've worked on

services.question: What services do you offer?
services.answer: I create websites, mobile apps, bots, automations, and fully custom projects to meet your needs.

projectDuration.question: How long does a typical project take?
projectDuration.answer: The time it takes depends on the size of the project. It could be as quick as a day or take a few months for larger projects.

maintenance.question: Do you offer maintenance after the project is complete?
maintenance.answer: Yes. You get a 30‑day bug‑fix warranty after launch. After that I offer on‑demand maintenance during business hours at my hourly rate; new features/redesigns are quoted separately.

maintenance.title: Maintenance & Support
maintenance.summary: 30‑day bug‑fix warranty. After that: on‑demand support only, hourly, business hours.

availability.title: Availability
availability.content: I'm a high‑school student working part‑time. I reply fast Sun–Thu, 09:00–18:00 (Asia/Jerusalem). Exam weeks may slow me down; I'll be upfront.

warranty.title: Warranty (included)
bullets: 30 days from acceptance.
Fix defects caused by my code that deviate from approved scope.
Remedy: fix or reasonable workaround.

scope.title: What maintenance covers
bullets: Security & dependency updates (on request)
Minor fixes/tweaks and small content edits (<15 min)
Light monitoring if I have access; backups if hosting allows
Version upgrades (framework/CMS) when safe; otherwise I’ll quote a mini‑upgrade

exclusions.title: Not included
bullets: New features or redesigns
Content writing, SEO/ads, analytics accuracy
Hosting/third‑party outages
Breaking platform changes or end‑of‑life
Legal/regulatory compliance

support.title: How on‑demand support works
bullets: You send a request → I triage quickly
I share an estimate → you approve
I do the work → send a short summary & invoice
Hourly rate set in proposal; 15‑minute minimum; rush may add a surcharge

targets.title: Targets (best‑effort, not SLA)
targets.p1: P1 (down): acknowledge ≤1 business day; start within 1–2 business days if I’m available.
targets.p2: P2 (degraded/bugs): acknowledge ≤1 business day; start within 2–3 business days.

client.title: Client responsibilities
bullets: Provide timely access (repo, hosting, CI/CD, third‑party accounts)
One point of contact and quick approvals
Keep domains/hosting/licenses current; keep backups if you self‑edit

thirdParty.title: Third‑party & upgrades
bullets: Third‑party costs are pass‑through
Breaking changes/EOL usually require a paid mini‑project

billing.title: Billing & pause
bullets: On‑demand work invoiced on completion (or weekly for bigger tasks)
Payment due on receipt; >7 days late → work pauses until paid

handover.title: Handover
bullets: You own the code after full payment
On request: brief runbook and one 30‑minute handoff call

maintenance.note: No guarantees of uptime/traffic/revenue. Advice is best‑effort. If a request becomes a feature, I’ll quote it separately.
maintenance.shortClause: Includes a 30‑day bug‑fix warranty. After that, I provide on‑demand maintenance during business hours at my hourly rate; new features/redesigns are quoted separately.
